action.action-desc: Mr. Buchanan (for himself and Mrs. McBath) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to permanently extend the Children’s Health Insurance Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Comprehensive Access to Robust Insurance Now Guaranteed for Kids Act or CARING for Kids Act.

section.header: Permanent extension of Children’s Health Insurance Program

subsection.text: Section 2104(a)(28) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397dd(a)(28)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2027 and each subsequent year, such sums as are necessary to fund allotments to States under subsections (c) and (m).

paragraph.text: Section 50101(b)(2) of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–123) is repealed.

section.header: Permanent extensions of other programs and demonstration projects

subsection.text: Section 1139A(i)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320b–9a(i)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking at the end and;

by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs:

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2028, $15,000,000 for the purpose of carrying out this section (other than subsections (e), (f), and (g)); and
